function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Correlation between population density and epidemics of contagious diseases (e.g., tuberculosis, avian flu, COVID-19).","Impact":"Inaccurate or conflicting conclusions about the relationship between population density and disease spread may lead to ineffective public health measures and interventions.","Mitigation":"Further analysis and research involving multiple variables such as income, education, and healthcare systems to provide a comprehensive understanding of disease spread in relation to population density.","Technologies":"Data collection and analysis tools, GIS mapping technology, statistical modeling.","People":"General population, public health officials, policymakers, researchers, urban planners.","Owner":"Research institutions, government agencies, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Limited ability to collect geolocation data for studying disease transmission in the built environment.","Impact":"Inability to accurately assess the impact of geographic factors on disease spread and implement targeted interventions in specific locations.","Mitigation":"Development of privacy-respecting geolocation data collection methods, incentivizing citizen participation in data collection efforts, improving data sharing protocols between governments and research institutions.","Technologies":"Privacy-enhancing geolocation data collection technologies, blockchain-based data sharing platforms, citizen science initiatives.","People":"Research institutions, governments, citizens.","Owner":"Public health organizations, government agencies, research institutions."}]}
